uk.co.strangeskies.observable

Interface Observable<M>

  • Type Parameters:
    M - The message type. This may be Void if no message need be sent.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ImmutableObservable<T>, ImmutableObservableValue<T>, LocaleManager, LocaleProvider, Localized<T>, ObservableCollection<S,E,C>, ObservableList<S,E>, ObservableProperty<T>, ObservableSet<S,E>, ObservableSortedSet<S,E>, ObservableValue<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFunctionBuffer, ActiveExpression, BooleanValue, ColdObservable, DependentExpression, ExecutorObservable, ExpressionBuffer, FunctionBuffer, HotObservable, IdentityExpression, IterableObservable, LocaleManagerService, LockingExpression, MergingObservable, ObservableListDecorator, ObservablePropertyImpl, ObservableSetDecorator, ObservableSortedSetDecorator, ScopedObservableSet, ScopedObservableSet.ScopedObservableSetImpl, SynchronizedObservableList, SynchronizedObservableSet, SynchronizedObservableSortedSet, UnmodifiableObservableList, UnmodifiableObservableSet, UnmodifiableObservableSortedSet

    public interface Observable<M>
    Simple interface for an observable object, with methods to add and remove observers expecting the applicable type of message.

    Unless otherwise specified, implementations should conceptually maintain the collection of observers according to the semantics of Set by object equality. Implementers should note that methods for weak observers and terminating observers must be reimplemented if anything other than default equality is used to determine membership.

      • weakReference

        default <O> Observable<OwnedMessage<O,M>> weakReference(O owner)
        Derive an observable which automatically disposes of observers at some point after the given owner is no longer weakly reachable.

        Care should be taken not to refer to the owner directly in any observer logic, as this will create a strong reference to the owner, preventing it from becoming unreachable. For this reason, the message is transformed into an OwnedMessage, which may create references to the owner on demand within observer logic without retainment.

        Parameters:
        owner - the referent
        Returns:
        the derived observable

        default Observable<M> softReference()

        Returns:

      • softReference

        default <O> Observable<OwnedMessage<O,M>> softReference(O owner)
        Derive an observable which automatically disposes of observers at some point after the given owner is no longer softly reachable.

        Care should be taken not to refer to the owner directly in any observer logic, as this will create a strong reference to the owner, preventing it from becoming unreachable. For this reason, the message is transformed into an OwnedMessage, which may create references to the owner on demand within observer logic without retainment.

        Parameters:
        owner - the referent
        Returns:
        the derived observable
